verses.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
How long shall I take counsel in my soul, \add having\add* sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
Consider \add and\add* hear me, O LORD my God: lighten my eyes, lest I sleep \add the sleep\add* of death;
Lest my enemy say, I have prevailed against him; \add and\add* those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
I will sing to the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
